3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.synopsis: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.

Backup_02.synopsis: Guard is bored and would rather be at the party outside.
Backup_02.how_to_trigger: teleport S_Gob_InnerCheckpoint_Backup_02Scene will trigger > Shft + Q to roll a success to avoid jailtalk to Lookout Tzig

Backup_04.synopsis: One of the guards at the door to the inner temple. He's been standing here for a while and shouldn've been switched out a while ago, but the change of guard never showed. He's very bored.

Backup_03.synopsis: Unless you're a (half)drow, this guard doesn't want you to be up in the rafters, but also isn't in the mood to really do anything about it.
Backup_03.how_to_trigger: create (half)drow characterteleport S_Gob_InnerCheckpoint_Backup_03talk to Lookout Gruz

Backup_01.synopsis: This guard is lowly backup, but eager to lord a position of authority over anyone they can.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: In analyzing the sessions, '3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins' can only occur if Sazza (the Captured Goblin) is freed, which means that any dialogue or scenario regarding guards would need to happen after this event. The other sessions, 'Backup_01', 'Backup_02', 'Backup_03', and 'Backup_04' seem to describe various guard interactions, but they do not have direct dependencies between them. However, based on the descriptions, these guard interactions might be triggered independently or in succession without affecting each other. There are no explicit exclusivity constraints mentioned in the synopses provided.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_1.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_1.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_3.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_3.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_3.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_2.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_2.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_2.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_4.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_4.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_4.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_0.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_0.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_0.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_5.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_5.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins_5.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

Backup_02_0.speaker: Tracker Tizg
Backup_02_0.text: Go on. If you've business in 'ere, best not to keep a True Soul waitin'.
Backup_02_0.context: NodeContext: Bored, done talking to you, ushering you inside

Backup_02_1.speaker: Tracker Tizg
Backup_02_1.text: Smell that meat sizzlin'? Can't tell if it's the brandin' or the party - makin' me bloody 'ungry either way.
Backup_02_1.context: NodeContext: Sniffing at the air - craving meat and jealous of the party going on outside.

Backup_04_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nozk
Backup_04_0.text: You outsiders never have ta guard the borin' posts.

Backup_04_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nozk
Backup_04_1.text: Thought you was my replacement, but noooo. Bet Mirg has drunk herself stupid.

Backup_03_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Gruz
Backup_03_1.text: What're you doin' up here anyway? Countin' spider webs? C'mon, get off.

Backup_03_2.speaker: Sharp-Eye Gruz
Backup_03_2.text: This ain't the party, mate - no foolin' around. Get back down.

Backup_01_0.speaker: Tracker Fezk
Backup_01_0.text: 'S good you ain't causin' trouble. Boss means business, now he's got the Absolute in his ear.
Backup_01_0.context: NodeContext: Tone of false threat - they've been handed a position of meagre authority and are trying to lord it over you.

Backup_01_1.speaker: Tracker Fezk
Backup_01_1.text: Before the Absolute, I'd've gut your kind without thinkin' twice. Funny, innit?
Backup_01_1.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Last line is bright, cheerful
